meanings.definition: A person who interprets or adheres strictly to the Bible.
meanings.sent1: The biblicists in our community gather every Sunday to discuss the teachings of the Bible.
meanings.sent2: Scholars often refer to biblicists as individuals who follow the Bible's teachings closely.
meanings.sent3: The biblicists at the debate were so engrossed in their interpretations that they forgot about the time.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to the Bible made her stand out as a biblicist among her peers.
meanings.sent5: The image of the biblicists poring over ancient texts left a lasting impression on the audience.

meanings.definition: Those who study or analyze the Bible in a scholarly manner.
meanings.sent1: As biblicists, they meticulously examine each verse to uncover its true meaning.
meanings.sent2: The biblicists' research shed new light on the historical context of the Bible.
meanings.sent3: During the seminar, the biblicists shared fascinating insights into biblical languages.
meanings.sent4: The group of biblicists approached the ancient text with a keen eye for detail.
meanings.sent5: The dedication of these biblicists to unraveling biblical mysteries is truly inspiring.
